meanings.definition: To sign a document alongside someone else as a joint responsibility.
meanings.sent1: I will cosign the lease with my sister for the apartment.
meanings.sent2: My parents agreed to cosign the loan for my new car.
meanings.sent3: I joked that I would cosign my friend's permission slip to go to the bathroom.
meanings.sent4: She decided to cosign the contract, sealing their partnership.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked me to cosign the test paper to confirm my identity.

meanings.definition: To support or endorse someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I will cosign your decision to pursue your dreams.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity agreed to cosign the charity event.
meanings.sent3: I cosign your choice of pizza toppings, they are delicious!
meanings.sent4: Her actions cosign her commitment to the cause.
meanings.sent5: The mentor's guidance will cosign your success in the project.

meanings.definition: A mathematical function that gives the ratio of the length of the side adjacent to an acute angle in a right-angled triangle to the length of the hypotenuse.
meanings.sent1: In trigonometry, the cosign helps calculate angles in triangles.
meanings.sent2: The student used the cosign to solve the geometry problem.
meanings.sent3: The cosign of the angle made the math lesson more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The cosign of the triangle's side revealed its proportions.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the cosign is crucial for solving trigonometric equations.
